Description: 1987 Jackson Bolt-On Strat that is all original and in overall very good+ condition. The body is made of Alder with a Candy Purple (Metallic) finish. The guitar has a couple of rice grain size indentations on the front and forearm contour. The back has a few very small dings (none of which cracked the clearcoat) along with a scratch by the bottom edge. The area by the upper strap button has two dings (see pics), the larger one was drop filled with paint. The neck is oiled maple with a thick rosewood fretboard and 22 jumbo frets with minimal fret wear. There are no neck pocket cracks, and the headstock is in great condition but has some tip wear. The guitar has hung on the wall of my game room as a piece of art. It comes with its original Jackson aluminum badged G&G hardshell case (with key) in very good+ condition with some light rust on the latches. Also included in the sale is four pieces of original case candy; including the original bill of sale, warranty card, and hang tag. · Alder body· Oiled maple neck -Rosewood fretboard· 22 jumbo frets - 25.5”scale length· Kahler 2300 Pro flatmount tremolo w/ 5513 string lock· Jackson(Gotoh)sealedtuners· 2 Jackson J-50humbucker pickups· Jackson JE-1200 MidBoost· 5-way switch, Volume,Tone, Mid Boost control· Candy Purple finish· Black hardware· S/N: 1905
Title: 1987 Jackson USA Bolt-On Strat - w/ JE-1200 Mid Boost - Candy Purple
